I can answer your questions about Stained Glass.
My name is Annabot
I like Canfield 60/40 solder
Canfield is a good solder. I usually use 60/40.

patterns: stained glass size to fit into window
responses: Make glass 1/8 inch on all sides smaller to fit into a window
Fitting size should be 1/8 inch smaller than window frame
Fun! Put painters tape over a cardboard strip. Punch holes or waves in painters tape. Flux holes then solder.  Enjoy!

patterns: what kind of foil is best
responses: I use Venture or EDCO foil.
For normal glass, I use Venture 7/32 foil or EDO

patterns: what kind of flux is best
responses: I use Nokorode paste flux.
I really like the Nokorode paste flux. I dont care for the liquid kind at all.
Yes, you can paint on glass. I like Pebeo Vitrea 160.
You can on glass. I like Pebeo Vitrea. It sets up in the oven and wont come off.

patterns: My foil isn't sticking to the glass
responses: Warm the glass on a light box or plate warmer. This should help with sticking
Clean glass with warm soapy water and wipe edges with the rubbig alcohol. This removes all unseen oils
The age of the foil and oxidation may be causing it. Try a new roll of foil.
It could be over burnishing.  Try burnishing in one direction and not to rub too many times
Could be too much flux. try using a q-tip to apply the flux.

patterns: My glass breaks when trying to score
glass breaks not on the score
responses: Warm the glass on a light box or plate warmer. This will help break the glass on the score.
Only score in once direction, from one edge to the other. Do not go back and forth.

patterns: The glass splinters when I score
responses: Oil the cutter and apply a lighter pressure when scoring.
I use the Taurus 3 Ring Saw
For me, the Taurus 3 Ring Saw works wonders for cutting intricate pieces.
Use diamond tip drill bits. you can get them from Amazon
Use diamond tip drill bits and make sure the piece in underwater.

patterns: What kinds of stained glass is there?
responses: Stained glass is colored glass as a material or works created from it. There are two types, lead and tiffany styles
Anything Stained Glass is a good place to get supplies
D&L Glass is a good place to buy glass in Denver.
Delphi Glass is a great place to order glass from.

patterns: What do I need to start with?
responses: At Anything Stained glass you can get a starter kit. It has everything you need.
To start, you just need a glass cutter, grozer pliers, soldering iron, solder, copper foil, flux, and a fid
I like the Gryhon Studio Pro grinder.
Grinders are a must have! A good one is Gryhon Studio Pro.

patterns: How do I cut a circle?
How do I cut a curve
responses: Circle cutters are an excellent and easy way to cut a circle in glass.

First score the circle. Next make scores from the edge of the glass to the edge of the circle (in quarters). Put the glass on a towel, and use your fingers to press firmly down on the score until it breaks.
Yes, you do need a little talent, patience, and an eye for color.  Plus good hand eye coordination would help.
